    Editors’ Guide

    First draft by Di Cook

    2021-09-13

    editors_guide.Rmd

    Mission

    As an Executive Editor (EE) for the R Journal you will be the primary article handler for about a quarter of submissions per year, with assignments given by the Editor-in-Chief (EIC). You will be responsible for:

    • matching the article with an appropriate Associate Editor (AE) or handling the reviews yourself.
    • communicating with AEs on submitted articles, and if necessary providing guidance to an AE about use of how GitHub is used, and relevant rj functionality
    • communicating progress and reviews with the corresponding author.
    • deciding if an article should be accepted, or rejected, or on an appropriate revision status, usually based on reviewer and AE feedback.
    • maintaining and enhancing the rj and rjtools software, in collaboration with other editors.

    Editorial structure

    The editorial board consists of four editors, including an Editor-in-Chief, and a non-fixed number of associate editors. Each editor serves a term of four years, starting on 1 January and ending on 31 December four years later. Associate editors serve a three year term, generally beginning in the calendar year of their invitation, and ending at the end of their third year.

    In the third year of their term the editor acts as Editor-in-Chief. The EIC takes primary responsibility for: - Production of two journal issues per year, in June and December. - Managing the flow of submissions, ensuring that these are handled in a timely manner. - Maintaining the R Journal web site http://journal.r-project.org - Maintaining the formatting and tools used to manage the journal. - Ensuring smooth communication between editors and associate editors.

    New editors and associate editors

    New editors and associate editors should be added to the editors.csv and associate_editors.csv files in inst folder.

    Communications

    Article repos need to be copied to the relevant ae-articles-XX. The articles repo is the master copy, and once a paper is retrieved from an AE, the DESCRIPTION file is updated, and the correspondence folder is populated.

    Slack is used for communication, between EIC, EEs and AEs, and general information about operations. The channel editors_private can be used for protected conversations between EEs.

    Weekly virtual meetings are held to keep communication between editors current.

    Workflow and operations

    Getting started

    Install the rj package with

    remotes::install_github("rjournal/rj")

    The package is being updated and revised regularly, so you may want to re-install occasionally.

    Potential AE

    The keywords of a paper should be matched against the keywords of AEs available in associate_editors.csv. Also, the function ae_workload() should be used to ensure that the potential AE hasn’t got too many current assignments.

    Workflow

    Dealing with problematic authors

    vexing_authors.csv
